availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William G. Butler (Caldwell County, KY, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Armstead Butler and Peggy Butler. Married to Mary E. Lowry Butler in Crittenden County, Kentucky, on December 13, 1855. Father of Thomas Butler and Sarah Butler. Student in Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Farmersville in 1860. Employed William James as a farm laborer in Farmersville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 274B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 147.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994032, Crittenden County Marriages, p. 1.
"William G. Butler (1836-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial #198479271, accessed December 2, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/198479271.
